author: hadriencroubois
content:
Among the 4 clients, is anyone ready to run medalla now ? I used to run onyx nodes and I know prysm isn't ... but I don't know about the 3 others.
Also, what is the best way to ask question that are not answered in the docs (for lighthouse, limbus and teku) ?

author: hadriencroubois
content: Last but not least: I know prysm runs well inside docker. I've also found a docker container for teku (which looks good so far) but I'm wondering if lighthouse an nimbus have docker images ready to run

author: hadriencroubois
content: Whoever build the `DoNotSendFundsHere` contract should consider changing line 71 for futur deployment. `owner.transfer()` can fail if owner is a smart contract

author: hadriencroubois
content: He/She could also consider adding `receive() payable` and `fallback() payable` that reverts to stop incomming eth transfers

author: benjaminion
content: <@!278099318647422977> Teku is ready for Medalla (some non-critical networking updates in progress, but otherwise good). The best channel to reach us on is via the ConsenSys Discord. See the `#teku` channel. Invite link: https://discord.gg/aT5TcBQ

author: benjaminion
content: And Medalla joining docs updated just now: https://docs.teku.pegasys.tech/HowTo/Get-Started/Connect-To-Testnet/ üòÄ

author: jgm
content:
> <@!144468805697929216> considering the tx also had no input data, i agree with <@!557201004060213248> 
> <https://etherscan.io/tx/0xe333f1d8e6363abddf1f54b4e853c530fdb538612a4cd7a93cef4bbfdbe794a8>
<@!97774605351010304> A transaction sent to the deposit contract with no data will revert.

author: butta
content: shouldn't happen in the first place...

author: jgm
content: You can't stop someone from sending Ether, though.

author: hadriencroubois
content:
> You can't stop someone from sending Ether, though.
<@!144468805697929216> you can by adding a payable receive() that reverts

author: butta
content: thats true, but i don't think anyone would voluntarily give away $10k.

author: jgm
content: Anything that dry-runs the transaction first will fail before sending, but if they send with a hard-coded gas limit and don't dry-run it will hit the network.

author: jgm
content:
> <@!144468805697929216> you can by adding a payable receive() that reverts
<@!278099318647422977> Sure (and as mentioned the deposit contract does that), but they can still _send_ the transaction.

author: hadriencroubois
content:
> <@!278099318647422977> Sure (and as mentioned the deposit contract does that), but they can still _send_ the transaction.
<@!144468805697929216> the you just lose the tx fee, which I believe is ok

author: jgm
content: As long as the deposit contract rejects the obvious erorrs (no data being the easiest, various malformed data being harder to catch) I don't think there is a lot more that can be done.

author: torfbolt
content: Are split deposits allowed? E.g. 2 separate TX with 16 ETH each for the same validator

author: torfbolt
content: Or something like: My validator balance went down to 31 ETH due to inactivity and I want to top it up to 32 by depositing another 1 ETH

author: torfbolt
content: Ah, found it, it is allowed: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/beacon-chain.md#deposits

author: Deleted User
content: <@&595683609080365088> Could anyone hint me how to deploy a contract with the same address with testnet contract üòÇ  https://etherscan.io/address/0x07b39f4fde4a38bace212b546dac87c58dfe3fdc#code

author: Deleted User
content: I thought those addresses were unique

author: djrtwo
content: Using CREATE, contract addresses are a function of sender addr and sender nonce

author: djrtwo
content: So if you have the same privkey as testnet deploy and havent used the nonce sequentially yet, you can deploy to same address

author: prestonvanloon
content: same sender, same nonce

author: Deleted User
content: I should try them, thank you!
